ratings.rComments: He may appear funny and quirky in lectures but when you see him in office, he is a different guy. When you ask him questions at his office, he's kind of obnoxious and gets offended when you say that you don't understand certain parts of the class material. Also, giving a 1/5 for helpfulness because for the 2 emails that I sent him he did not reply

Professor Frame is an amazing and pun-filled professor. His class is perfect for non-STEM majors. (And for people that couldn't get in ATMS 120) He's a true weather nerd, and loves teaching. The reading assignments get a little repetitive, but they're easy. You get points just for participating on the iclicker questions.
He is a ok teacher. Could be more interesting.  Tests were fair.  Requires attendance and labs are not boring.

He would be a much better teacher if he didn't act so snarky and arrogant. As it stands right now, his attitude makes him pretty hard to listen to. I understand a certain amount of sarcasm is alright from anyone, but Frame is pretty over the top. If it's between his Atmos 100 and Snodgrass's Atmos 120, take Snodgrass.

I enjoyed going to Frame's class everyday. He was very interesting and knowledgeable about the subjects he was teaching. His test can be a little challenging but not impossible and they aren't a big part of your grade. He gives out easy extra credit  and the final is not cumulative and its the same weight on your score as a regular exam.

Tests are not too bad, but Frame is the man. He knows everything about the weather and knows how to make his students interested. Puns are thrown in for good measure. Would highly recommend to anyone needing to fulfill for a gen-ed or just wanting to take an interesting class. Put a slight bit of work in and you will get an A.
Really nice guy and makes the material interesting. Definitely knows what he is talking about and as long as you do the work you're golden!

Grossly misled that the final was cumu; was entirely on tornadoes & supercells. HWs are easy, just be sure to ask questions early. Study PPTs well in advance of exams. Random quizzes announced 1 class prior, start studying ASAP bc they're specific. The boundary layer quiz is notoriously hard. Could have done better in the class if I'd studied more.

All the answers to reading assignments are online somewhere. Find them. Labs are all right if you have smart partners ;) Tests are not that easy just saying. You DO have to study. Book is useless. I-clickers every class so yes go to lecture. Overall easy-ish class. Whatever I got an A. :P

This class was pretty rough. Just make sure when quizzes are announced, start studying the related powerpoint THAT DAY. Study for exams with lectures and HW. Exams questions are asked the same way homework questions are. Directional/speed shear are ALWAYS on the first exam, which I thought was unnecessary. Final is terrible from what I've heard.
Highly recommend it!!!!!!!!
Go to lecture for iclicker points. Lab is easy. Tests are more difficult than one might expect, so study if you want an A. Frame knows the material and keeps things interesting.
Iclickers are not grader for accuracy and online homework is usually simple but his tests are difficult if you don't understand all the concepts. Be sure to pay attention and read the book.

Very good professor as he was so good at engagaing interesting and funny jokes in lectures. The exams are a little challenge because good memorization skills can not guarantee you to do well, TA are nice and helpful, assignments are straight foward and easy. Highly recommend this class for a science Gen Ed.

This is a "field observation course" where you go out on the plains for two weeks after finals in the spring. It was SO much fun, DEFINITELY worth your money! Try to get on the first trip cause the second one is after tornado season is dying down/over and is notoriously not as good as the first trip. I learned so much about storm structure. AWESOME

Great guy with all his puns and jokes about current events. Made the weather very interesting and easy to understand. You will get an A so long as you study the lecture slides and form a study group to do RAs together (to get the full points!).

I took this class because it sounded interesting and ended up getting an A+. Professor Frame explains the material well, constantly makes puns and jokes (which was great at 9am), and was very thorough in his explanations. This class is all about understanding concepts and not memorizing, but it's interesting and well taught - you'll WANT to learn.

This class is awesome because of the professor. He explains everything so clearly that it's hard to misunderstand him. Overall, the course has easy reading assignments due before every lecture and iclicker points. As long as you go to class and study for a few hours before each exam, you will get an A or a B, guaranteed.

This class is not hard at all, but there is online reading quiz before every class, and iclicker questions for attendance. He gives out study guides and you can find all the answers from the powerpoint lectures he put online. Overall, the exam was okay, not very easy, but not hard at all. As long as you study a little bit, and knows the concept.

Memorize and remember the concepts of the powerpoint. Go to class for i-clickers. If you do all reading assignments and labs correctly, you can ensure a good grade. This class isn't difficult, you just need to study the powerpoints.

Go to class to get the iclicker points, do all the has (take 5 min to do), go to every lab and its impossible NOT to get an A. Enthusiastic professor that wants kids to succeed. Tests are easy as long as you put one night of studying every chapter on test and he offers extra credit after every exam worth about 8 points
Enjoyable and well taught class.  Also very easy.  Professor Frame is the man!!

Used the book on ONE lab because he copied it too big so it was too pixelated. Luckily it was isoplethed in the book. Exams are easy - just memorize EVERYTHING on slides and know how to do specific things like recalculating resolution. 2 exams + final, labs due every week (sometimes the day they're given), forecast due every class. Not hard though!

KNOW EVERY LITTLE THING ON EVERY POWER POINT. Labs are not as helpful for exams as they were for 303 so rely heavily on lecture slides for study material. On the first exam he asked us something he grazed over in class which was very disappointing. It was one line on one slide in one lecture and it showed up on the exam - 6 points wasted. So sad.

If you can deal with the huge amount of Greek life during lecture then this class will be a breeze. Labs & Reading Assignments really keep your grade up. So do good on those. Exams are hard but they aren't easy. Frame is awesome and really knows his stuff

Frame was Great! I hate that everyone says this is an easy A class. I definitely wouldn't say so. Yes the homework & labs are fairly easy but the exams were not! So, with that being said do good on every homework and lab assignment. It will help your grade in the end. My friends failed the exams and got B's or C's. I got B's on them all & got an A

Frame is one of the best forecasters and storm chasers in the nation. With that, he is also a great professor. ATMS 100 is quite easy and I took it only for the A since there is only crossover with ATMS 120 & 201. Still he delivers the material very well and also his ability to spew out puns is insane and great. Can't wait to have him in 300 level.

I adore this professor. He was so intelligent and nerdy, but it just made learning about the weather that much better! The class definitely wasn't an easy A, but as long as you pay attention and do your labs right, you'll do well and enjoy the class that much more :)

Consistently puts students down & raises his voice when they ask a question he thinks they should already know. Very nit-picky about material so KNOW THE MATERIAL. Preaches about how we will use the book required for this class in 314 but we never use it in this class. But I did learn a lot. Be prepared to isopleth on exams. STUDY LABS!!!

Pretty easy class if you pay attention in lecture and lab, instead of sitting on the computer. Quiz questions come from straight out of the book. Attendance mandatory because of i-clicker questions. Overall, pretty good teacher.

Super easy class. Attendance is mandatory in order to get i-clicker points but the lectures really arent too boring. Labs are pretty easy and so are the exams. I got a C on one of the exams and still got an A due to extra credit and the homework which is worth a lot. this class requires work but its nothing bad at all. take this class, easy easy.

Frame is a great professor who is very knowledgeable. You can tell that he loves meteorology. He has the best puns ever.  Go to lecture and attend the labs, and this class will be a piece of cake. The tests aren't too bad if you go over the slides. Great class and great professor, he truly made me become interested in the weather.

Frame is awesome. One of my favprite classes. The punniest man I know. He made class fun to attend. Very fair syllabus. Go to class, go to lab, and finish all hw assignments online and you will get an A. Get passed a few voice cracks and you will fall in love with this guy
my favorite class!! as long as you do the work and pay attention in class you'll be fine. very interesting and professor frame is hilarious

Great Guy, Frame and the TAs do everything they can to get you an A, all you have to do is put forth a little effort. His jokes are kind of corny but some are really funny. Great QRII class, i'm horrible at science and he made this so easy and fun.

He is really easy if you do your work . The only thing you have to do is go to class for i-clicker questions (only answer 3 out of the 4), do the reading assessments (which you can google the question), and attend discussion. Even though the 2nd test is the hardest, there is no reason anyone should fail until you do nothing at all.

BEST TEACHER EVER! Super enthusiastic-he actually made it interesting. Very straightforward, just look at the powerpoints for the tests. He gives plenty of extra credit, but go to class for i-clickers.

Professor Frame is awesome.  He makes puns and quotes the Simpsons, and he is also very informative.  The exams can sometimes be tricky, but if you do all the work you should be fine.  A very enjoyable class!

This guy is awesome. Extremely passionate about the weather, will gladly tell you about his storm chasing experiences, etc. He makes the corniest puns and talks in a super-nerdy, high-pitched, nasally voice that cracks occasionally. Very amusing guy, easy class. You don't really NEED the textbook though. At least I don't use it.
Great teacher. I clicker questions, compass reading quizes, labs were easy. Tests are easy if you pay attention and review the slides and study guide. Worth taking.
